 I. [<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נָתַר‎</span>] **verb** ==spring or start up==; — 

**Qal** ***Imperfect*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְיִתַּר מִמְּקוֺמוֺ‎</span> [[Job.37.1|Job 37:1]] ***yea, it*** (the heart) ***starts up from its place*** (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יֶחֱרַד‎</span>). **Pi\`el** ***Infinitive*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לְנַתֵּר בָּהֵן עַלהָֿאָרֶץ‎</span> [[Lev.11.21|Lev 11:21]] ([[BDB#P|P]]), ***to leap with them*** (i.e. its legs) ***upon the earth*** (of locust). **Hiph\`il** ***Imperfect*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַיַּתֵּר גּוֺיִם‎</span> [[Hab.3.6|Hab 3:6]] he (<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎י‎</span>) looked, ***and made nations start up***. 



 II. [<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נָתַר‎</span>] **verb** ==be free, loose== (? usually placed below I., but connection not obvious; compare also Late Hebrew Niph\`al ***free oneself***, Hiph\`il = Biblical Hebrew; perhaps compare Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***rend*** a garment, ***break*** string (of bow), etc.); — 

**Hiph\`il** ***Imperfect*** 3 masculine singular jussive <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יַתֵּר‎</span> [[Job.6.9|Job 6:9]] suffix <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַיַּתִּירֵהוּ‎</span> [[Ps.105.20|Ps 105:20]] ***Infinitive absolute*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הַתֵּר‎</span> [[Isa.58.6|Isa 58:6]] ***Participle*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַתִּיר‎</span> [[Ps.146.7|Ps 146:7]] — 

**1.** ***unfasten, loosen***, with accusative of thing; thongs of yoke [[Isa.58.6|Isa 58:6]] (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎פַּתֵּחַ‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎תְּנַתֵּ֑קוּ‎</span>). 

**2.** ***set free, unbind*** with accusative of person, prisoners [[Ps.105.20|Ps 105:20]] (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַיְפַתְּחֵהוּ‎</span>), [[Ps.146.7|Ps 146:7]] figurative <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יַתֵּר יָדוֺ‎</span> [[Job.6.9|Job 6:9]] ***that he would let loose his hand*** and cut me off, — <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַיַּתֵּר‎</span> [[2Sam.22.33|2Sam 22:33]] was possibly connected by Masoretes with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎תּוּר‎</span> (see Commentaries), but read <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַיִּתֵּן‎</span> (as \|\| [[Ps.18.33|Ps 18:33]]).
